data.quotes: Learning expands great souls.
data.author: Namibian Proverb

data.quotes: You always learn a lot more when you lose than when you win.
data.author: African Proverb

data.quotes: You learn how to cut down trees by cutting them down.
data.author: Bateke Proverb

data.quotes: Advice is a stranger; if heâ€™s welcome he stays for the night; if not, he leaves the same day.
data.author: Malagasy Proverb

data.quotes: It always seems possible until it's done.
data.author: Nelson Mandela

data.quotes: Do not scare the birds you are going to shoot.
data.author: Malagasy Proverb

data.quotes: No matter how long the winter, spring is sure to follow.
data.author: Guinean Proverb

data.quotes: If there were no elephant in the jungle, the buffalo would be a great animal.
data.author: Ghanaian Proverb

data.quotes: He who wants to be famous will have many sleepless nights.
data.author: African Proverb

data.quotes: An old story does not open the ear as a new one does.
data.author: Beninese Proverb

data.quotes: A man cannot sit down alone to plan for prosperity.
data.author: Nigerian Proverb

data.quotes: Water that has been begged for does not quench the thirst.
data.author: Soga People from Uganda Proverb

data.quotes: There are no shortcuts to the top of the palm tree.
data.author: African Proverb

data.quotes: For tomorrow belongs to the people who prepare for it today.
data.author: African Proverb

data.quotes: To try and to fail is not laziness.
data.author: African Proverb

data.quotes: Even the best dancer on the stage must retire sometime.
data.author: African Proverb

data.quotes: Those who accomplish great things pay attention to little ones.
data.author: African Proverb

data.quotes: Hope does not disappoint.
data.author: African Proverb

data.quotes: If you want to go quickly, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.
data.author: African Proverb

data.quotes: The earth is a beehive, we all enter by the same door.
data.author: African Proverb
